text: b'As we near the end of 2020, I\xe2\x80\x99ve taken a step back to reflect with the help of one of my favorite authors, @harari_yuval. In his book Sapiens, he reminds us of just how many obstacles humans have overcome throughout history. What books have impacted you this year? https://t.co/VxzjEjruE9'

b'There is a long-standing connection between sports and business - each offering valuable lessons for the other. The new MBA sports institute from @aists_india will nurture this rich relationship, laying the groundwork for the next generation of sports professionals.'

b"As so many of us celebrate Thanksgiving without the usual gathering of friends and family this year, let\xe2\x80\x99s come together here for just a moment to share what we're reflecting on today. What have you found yourself feeling most grateful for this year? https://t.co/VbSvGdiT0F"

b'Congratulations to @LaurenHobart for being named the CEO of @DICKS. Lauren was a great leader during her time at @PepsiCo and has clearly brought sharp strategy and superb management to Dick\xe2\x80\x99s Sporting Goods. I\xe2\x80\x99m just one of many who are thrilled to see her take on this new role. https://t.co/AUS8zcdfio'

b'During Hispanic Heritage Month, you all shared your favorite books by Hispanic authors. It\xe2\x80\x99s essential that our reading lists are diverse and bring new perspectives to light, so I\xe2\x80\x99m eager to add these recommendations to my reading list and I hope you do as well. https://t.co/4P6a8escs7'

b'Building a better work culture starts with the top. Col. Everett Spain\xe2\x80\x99s article on how the @USArmy created a new process for selecting leaders is a must read. There are many relevant lessons that corporations can apply to their talent management outlook: \nhttps://t.co/aWx2y6Vpo6'

b'As a proud @Yankees fan, I\xe2\x80\x99m thrilled to see Kim Ng make history as the first woman hired as a General Manager in @MLB. This is a testament to her talent and hard work, as my friend and @Marlins chief executive Derek Jeter notes in this piece. I\xe2\x80\x99ll be rooting for her next season. https://t.co/jkDEUMtwEU'

b'This year we must think about the Festival of Lights in a new way \xe2\x80\x93 making memories at home rather than gathering like we normally would. But the spirit of Diwali to overcome lives within us. From my family to yours, I wish you a Diwali filled with light, hope, and good health. https://t.co/2ksT5OuQAJ'

b'Next week\xe2\x80\x99s @thegeforum is an opportunity to learn about urgent global trends and events like the 2020 U.S. election and the COVID-19 pandemic from an illustrious group of speakers, including @AriannaHuff, @SteveCase, @RayDalio, David Rubenstein and more: https://t.co/uGS3zz3lQP https://t.co/W9kqjAr6WZ'

b'The @EarthshotPrize aims to inspire innovation and support those who come up with the brightest ideas to save our planet. Today, the nomination process for the most prestigious global environment prize in history begins - it will be thrilling to see where it takes us. https://t.co/1jV9gaZTHk'

b'Fixing the care crisis means finding solutions that work for everyone in a family. @dianamlind\xe2\x80\x99s case for multigenerational housing does just that. It\xe2\x80\x99s inspiring to see policy specialists exploring how their areas of expertise can impact care systems. https://t.co/hO7XhuUblx'

b"As corporations work to actualize racial equity and inclusiveness in the workplace, @MLTOrg's #MLTBlackEquityatWork certification sets a strong example. It provides a clear, actionable blueprint to make help make equity a reality, not just a talking point. https://t.co/haaGlP54Is"

b'The #CARE100 list highlights the brightest innovators in the care ecosystem and provides an unprecedented opportunity to improve our caregiving infrastructure together. I encourage you all to learn more about the work of this impressive group.\n\nhttps://t.co/q0KAYLxLga'

b'In his profound book, Walking, Erling Kagge resurrects what so many throughout history have told us before: that walking is the best medicine. Kagge draws our attention back to the restorative power of movement and the outdoors\xe2\x80\x94a simple premise with a lasting impact. https://t.co/a09SDwa9gM'

b'Reading books from authors who hail from a wide variety of backgrounds is one of the best ways to understand new perspectives. During #HispanicHeritageMonth, I\xe2\x80\x99ve been especially interested in reading more from Hispanic authors\xe2\x80\x94are there any books or authors you would recommend?'

b'The climate is changing much faster than originally anticipated, and if we don\xe2\x80\x99t act soon, the harm we are doing to the planet will be irreversible. Despite the scale of the challenge ahead, I am optimistic businesses can play a key role in leading change: https://t.co/xk0Kkm5ogl'

b'Over the next ten years, the @EarthshotPrize will help incentivize great thinkers to put together solutions to help repair our planet. I am proud to be a part of the #EarthshotPrize Council with such an incredible group of global leaders and can\xe2\x80\x99t wait to get started. https://t.co/VJqLlBuw44'

b'Last week, many of you shared the struggles and small joys of being a working parent during this pandemic. By sharing the common themes from your experiences I hope that we can learn from one another, continue this critical discussion, and ultimately work towards solutions. https://t.co/ui23kDVX39'

b'For any young woman interested in science, look no further for inspiration than @Astro_Ellen, who was the first Hispanic woman to visit space. Ellen is a trailblazer who reminds us that there is no boundary too far to break. Who is inspiring you this #HispanicHeritageMonth? https://t.co/gDynaByMIx'

b'Working parents are demonstrating admirable grit and creativity as they adjust to the fact that many schools and childcare services are not yet operating in-person. I\xe2\x80\x99m eager to learn how this is impacting your family. Working parents, what has worked and what needs to change?'

b'@ariannahuff @moiraforbes @JulieSweet @sherylsandberg @reshmasaujani It has been so impactful to see how she inspired so many of us \xe2\x80\x93 all in different facets of our lives and careers. We would not be where we are today without her. Thank you for sharing, Arianna.'

b'Women don\xe2\x80\x99t belong on the sidelines. They belong in the ring fighting. Ruth Bader Ginsburg dedicated her life\xe2\x80\x99s work to this belief and generations of women are stronger for it. We lost a genuine heroine, but we must keep our gloves on and fight to keep her legacy alive. https://t.co/bs1UnPwnPR'

b'Congratulations to Jane Fraser for being named the next CEO of @Citi and becoming the first woman to lead a major U.S. financial firm. This achievement is a testament to her talent, drive, and the countless women who paved the way for any of us who are the \xe2\x80\x9cfirst\xe2\x80\x9d in our role. https://t.co/vgEGQ0L5O9'

b'#InternationalLiteracyDay should be a reminder that opportunity \xe2\x80\x93 to read and learn, but also to live in comfort and safety \xe2\x80\x93 is a resource shared unevenly. Evicted, by @just_shelter, is a remarkable study of this painful reality in American cities. This book is a must-read. https://t.co/rj5hfJf5FP'

b'I recently shared a lovely conversation with my good friend @DavidNovakOGO, discussing our shared time at PepsiCo and what it means to be a great leader. David embodies so many skills of an expert leader himself and I hope you\xe2\x80\x99ll enjoy listening to our conversation. https://t.co/kxG0QkKoo1'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99m honored to have some of my leadership principles included in David Rubenstein\xe2\x80\x99s new book, How to Lead. His book provides a unique opportunity to learn from the perspectives of some exceptional individuals and I hope it\xe2\x80\x99s as educational for you as it was for me. https://t.co/EOo0bOHIUF'
b'RT @LibnOfCongress: Today the @librarycongress will be celebrating the centennial of the #19thAmendment by illuminating the Jefferson Build\xe2\x80\xa6'

b'Sometimes the most enjoyable books are the ones that you can escape into, which is why @daniellesteel is one of my favorite authors. Her incredible following demonstrates just how many people relate to her writing, and her work frequently lands on my list of things to read next. https://t.co/shnpxxD3vs'

b"I am truly excited and encouraged by @JoeBiden\xe2\x80\x99s selection of @KamalaHarris to be his Vice President. I\xe2\x80\x99ve had the privilege to get to know Kamala personally and find her to be brilliant, loving and committed to building America's future. This is a great choice for our country."

b'Our nation laid to rest the great Representative John Lewis, a figure who felt larger than the world because he changed it. The Congressman\xe2\x80\x99s essay illuminates that we can keep his legacy alive by speaking up for what is right and causing good trouble. https://t.co/jRYWItQxeQ'

b'The Great Influenza by @johnmbarry is an incredible walk through the history of the 1918 Spanish flu. This quote struck a chord with me as I worked on the taskforce to reopen Connecticut, and I hope the book provides you a lens through which to see the COVID-19 crisis as well. https://t.co/bmqPDc4FbR'

b'Although the 2020 @Olympics have been postponed, today I\xe2\x80\x99m reflecting on the influence that the female athletes who participate in the games have on girls and women all over the world. The dedication, work ethic, and courage they display can motivate and inspire us every day. https://t.co/DHwG6O39CH'

b'In her insightful book, Feminist City, @LellyK explores gendered urban landscapes, asking us to consider what cities designed with women in mind would look like. I hope this galvanizes a debate on how to re-think cities for working women and couples. https://t.co/ll7zVqsXLZ https://t.co/k7t2TbF3OS'

b'A great book has the power to open up the most challenging and valuable discussions with others. I\xe2\x80\x99ve joined @goodreads so that we can have more of these conversations. I hope you\xe2\x80\x99ll follow along to see what I\xe2\x80\x99m reading: https://t.co/mcHxAUUmwO https://t.co/vWZpDnXsLm'

b"As the world navigates the ravages of the pandemic, David Cote and @fredhochberg offer readers two gripping analyses\xe2\x80\x94the first on balancing the short and long term at companies, and the second exploring the importance of free trade. Both are must-reads in today's environment. https://t.co/tbloC71czG"

b'I am honored to sit on the review panel for the #EqualityCantWaitChallenge, an effort championed by @melindagates to accelerate the pace of change for women in the United States. This initiative is launching during a key moment for our country. I encourage you all to learn more. https://t.co/7kZKaC8NjW'

b'My father raised me to believe that my capabilities are boundless. My daughters possess similar conviction, and I know that their own father, my husband, played a key role in this. To the men who roll up their sleeves to raise confident children, thank you and happy #FathersDay! https://t.co/M2ifdIx7a2'
b'RT @NatGeo: Americans are celebrating #Juneteenth today, but what exactly does the day signify? 1/10 https://t.co/v11oacDV5N'

b'As protests sweep the country, we all have a role to play. Below, I offer reflections about what this moment means for our country and how we can listen, learn, and act. #BlackLivesMatter https://t.co/qnaOIA7Gc9'

b'When our caregiving systems starts to fail, it\xe2\x80\x99s predominantly women who pick up the slack. This moment should be a call-to-action for both the public and private sectors \xe2\x80\x93 we need to enact solutions before the care crisis gets even worse. \nhttps://t.co/CzH1lResIe'

b"It\xe2\x80\x99s wonderful to see the innovative ways that one person can help communities across the country during this time of uncertainty. @CharityChelseas's kits are a reminder that we all have the power to impact others through kindness. Great work, Chelsea! https://t.co/Rg5inSS6UJ"

b"This #MothersDay is unique, as we're celebrating during a global health crisis. In these times, so many mothers have become full-time caregivers in addition to their jobs. This deserves not only our praise, but also action. We need better support systems even beyond this moment. https://t.co/dQvjt8XCnk"

b'We bear witness to a fraction of the impact that our positivity has on the world. Doing good inspires good in others, which is why one smile to a stranger, a simple act of recognition, travels such a far distance. In times like these, Maya Angelou\xe2\x80\x99s words ring particularly true. https://t.co/3WETnyzVt0'

b'As we all face new challenges, I\xe2\x80\x99m inspired by the strength so many have shown. The tireless efforts of teachers, parents, neighbors, delivery workers, transit operators, health care professionals, and so many others should give us hope that a brighter future is ahead. https://t.co/IzjSCNYUF0'

b'Sending my deepest condolences to the @Yankees organization and the Steinbrenner family today. I know we\xe2\x80\x99ll all be celebrating Hank\xe2\x80\x99s legacy when the team is able to take the field again. https://t.co/C2t4zjFGMd'

b'This will be a thoughtful and coordinated effort, and we will have to learn as we go. It\xe2\x80\x99s a privilege to work with @PMounds and Dr. Albert Ko on Connecticut\xe2\x80\x99s council and collaborate with the groups from NY, NJ, PA, DE, RI, and MA to build towards a safe economic reopening.'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99m proud to co-chair @GovNedLamont\xe2\x80\x99s council in the multi-state effort to safely restore our regional economy. This will be a tremendous task, but a critically important one. I applaud our leaders for bringing our communities together to take on this challenge. https://t.co/2kOJg4ZJKw'

b'In challenging times, it\xe2\x80\x99s essential that we stay optimistic about the future and realistic about how we get there. Marie Curie\xe2\x80\x99s words remind us that knowledge should be embraced, not feared. Only from there can we begin to work towards a better future. https://t.co/5Z0Bt912qC'

b'These words from Henry James remind me that through this crisis we must all do our best to care for each other and for our communities. To the healthcare workers, grocery store employees, and countless others \xe2\x80\x93 thank you for your kindness and bravery in these uncertain times. https://t.co/zwAXJoUL3h'

b'Children must have access to the resources they need to continue an education, and with school cancellations as a result of #COVID19, Raj and I are eager to do our part by donating all the educational material required from @Scholastic to K-8 children in all CT school districts. https://t.co/dnBfPWAc4I'

b'This International Women\xe2\x80\x99s Day, I\xe2\x80\x99ll be celebrating by watching the @T20WorldCup Women\xe2\x80\x99s Cricket Final. Today in particular, I\xe2\x80\x99m reflecting on the lessons I learned as a young girl playing cricket and how they still impact me today. What inspires you on this #IWD2020? https://t.co/ceDZhMZ0Lw'

b'We all need inspiration to break boundaries \xe2\x80\x94 and like the women of this year\xe2\x80\x99s @T20WorldCup, I\xe2\x80\x99ve always been inspired by the great @BillieJeanKing. This weekend, I encourage all who can to #FILLTHEMCG and be inspired by the exceptional athletes competing in the final match. https://t.co/wKKfDHhRLZ'

b'With so many women around the world still constrained from reaching their full potential, this book from @p_santilli, @MBauerM, and Marty Seldman examines how we can support their success, specifically in Latin America. An invaluable read on a critical topic. https://t.co/IVPaArn1bO'

b'For the last century, the League of Women Voters has empowered and supported women throughout the US to take action in politics. It was a great honor to receive the @LWVCT\xe2\x80\x99s Outstanding Woman in Business award and be recognized by the organization on its 100th birthday. #LWV100 https://t.co/8O9v8LzF4Y'

b'Katherine Johnson demonstrated that there is no such thing as an unreachable destination when you possess the right combination of curiosity and determination \xe2\x80\x93 not even the moon. What a powerful legacy to leave behind. https://t.co/zN2QZnVLOA'

b'As we celebrate #BlackHistoryMonth, I\xe2\x80\x99m reflecting on the immeasurable influence of people like Carter G. Woodson who worked tirelessly to champion African American history. His legacy, like so many others, reminds us that learning from the past opens the door to the future. https://t.co/joqbzqLGhW'

b'Changing workplace culture starts at the top and the onus is on our leaders to work to eliminate the biases and systems that lead to gender inequality. This #WEF20 piece is a good reminder that looking at the bigger picture can help solve these challenges: https://t.co/kofEutwTTf'

b'With the @ICC Women\xe2\x80\x99s #T20WorldCup final taking place on #IWD2020, the significance of shining a spotlight on women who are center stage is not lost on me. Let\xe2\x80\x99s #FILLTHEMCG and send a message to girls watching that they could be on that pitch one day too: https://t.co/YKUlDshfN6 https://t.co/5Y7Yzh8oCt'

b'Bridgital Nation provides an authentic view of India today and an ambitious vision for its future \xe2\x80\x93 particularly for women and their critical place in the Indian economy. In honor of India\xe2\x80\x99s Republic Day, I recommend this book to anyone seeking to understand India\xe2\x80\x99s potential. https://t.co/jKDhrgTx1b'

b'Dr. King brought together a nation around the message of unity. He taught so many, myself included, to recognize the value of those who are unseen and he worked tirelessly to lift up their stories. What is the most powerful lesson that Dr. King has taught you? https://t.co/MagswBz8ur'

b'This piece from @HarvardBiz illustrates how women can be powerful professional mentors not only for other women, but for men as well. I encourage everyone \xe2\x80\x93 regardless of their gender \xe2\x80\x93 to consider how they could be empowered by finding a female mentor. https://t.co/651fTjSC3Z'

b'Last week I joined my former colleague Mehmood Khan to reflect on our time at @PepsiCo at the @AABRoundtable Summit. It was inspiring to see how the lessons we learned there have stood the test of time, from the importance of sticking to our values to balancing work and life. https://t.co/7Y0SnKyM91'

b'As each year ends, I\xe2\x80\x99m astounded by our capacity for growth in a single year \xe2\x80\x93 personally, professionally, and on a global scale. As we head into the start of a new decade, I hope that we can all channel this spirit to be agents of positive change in all aspects of our lives. https://t.co/ThG3iwKz9j'

b"Congratulations to the inspiring women named to @Forbes' 2019 list of the World\xe2\x80\x99s 100 Most Powerful Women. They\xe2\x80\x99ve impacted us all through exciting innovation, passionate advocacy, and the brightest ideas. I hope their stories will empower you. https://t.co/h3lTBHzTUo"

b'Now more than ever, leaders are expected to take a stand on the forces shaping our world, even when the topic is controversial. This @WSJ piece is a reminder that the role of the CEO is changing to focus on social issues that could impact the bottom line: https://t.co/RHyEmMRDR5'

b'Hearing a classic story retold from a new perspective is a refreshing way to broaden the ways we see the world around us. @cdivakaruni\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cThe Forest of Enchantments\xe2\x80\x9d does this brilliantly, bringing new life to the stories of the women in an epic tale, the Ramayana. https://t.co/avtGSDEUcq'

b'Thanksgiving offers us a moment to reflect on fuel that powers us forward every day. For me, it is the strong wills of my daughters, the love of my husband, and the people around the world who unite their differences to bring new ideas to life. What are you thankful for? https://t.co/pbN1vuOXDt'

b'Stories of Americans of every faith, ethnicity, and background are displayed here - a powerful reminder of the diversity that has shaped this country. My sincere thank you to Jon R. Friedman for beautifully capturing my story in this portrait and to @ibarguen for your kind words. https://t.co/Zj7FoT5ll0'

b'When I arrived in the United States from India I never dared to think \xe2\x80\x93 as a South Asian, immigrant woman \xe2\x80\x93 that my portrait would be included in the permanent collection of the @SmithsonianNPG. I am moved beyond measure to be embraced as part of the American story in this way. https://t.co/PTcx9NsqCE'

b'The lessons Stephen Schwarzman shares in his book, \xe2\x80\x9cWhat It Takes\xe2\x80\x9d are extraordinarily valuable for anyone with big goals. He proves that a commitment to constant improvement can power success. This is an excellent resource for smart leadership. https://t.co/smERqV4F8n'

b'Today more than ever, it can feel as though there is more bad in the world than good. And yet, #Diwali is a time to challenge this notion \xe2\x80\x94 a time to recognize that we are capable of triumphing over darkness with the light, knowledge, and optimism within ourselves. Happy Diwali! https://t.co/eBnD9cMegV'

b'In her book, \xe2\x80\x9cTough Love\xe2\x80\x9d @AmbassadorRice reminds us that through even the greatest professional challenges, the lessons that our families impart on us are what we use to guide us. She has shown a relentless dedication to the pursuit of service that we can all work to replicate. https://t.co/T8HUl6BLKX'

b'Far too often, women in leadership are forced to choose between progressing in their careers and their families \xe2\x80\x93 something I too struggled to balance. In this @Forbes piece by @ShelleyZalis, I appreciate her focus on the ways women can rewrite the rules.  https://t.co/cruHppgEi6'

b'It was an honor to speak with @LauraArnoldFdn at the @AsiaSociety about the impact of strong mentors. As a woman, person of color, and immigrant, having advocates in my career helped me see that I could succeed without fitting the mold of those around me. https://t.co/yBrtxYy0K0 https://t.co/pAXeKuOxRR'

b'This speech is something I return to time and again as a blueprint for my own life, as Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.\xe2\x80\x99s words are just as true today as when he spoke them so many years ago. Whatever it is that we aspire to be, we should be the best version of that self.'

b'On the anniversary of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. receiving the Nobel Peace Prize, I\xe2\x80\x99m reflecting on his brilliant speech \xe2\x80\x9cWhat Is Your Life\xe2\x80\x99s Blueprint?\xe2\x80\x9d where he reminds us that we can achieve anything we set our minds to, so long as we believe that we are capable and worthy. https://t.co/YzJOKvtpDx'

b'Unconscious bias can have a toxic effect on how women view their worth in the workplace \xe2\x80\x94 but by forming a supportive sisterhood that seeks to empower each other and call out bad behavior, I believe women have the capacity to turn this dynamic around. https://t.co/GPUZ2TE7YJ'
b'@STsumikotan @PepsiCo Thank you, Sumiko, for such a lovely conversation!'

b"It was a pleasure to attend @GEP_Worldwide's Innovate 2019 Digital Transformation Conference and discuss the major trends and tools that are shaping businesses in the 21st century. Conversations of this nature are essential as the landscape of the workforce continues to shift. https://t.co/p0TCLogmtX"
b'@cdivakaruni @asiasocietytx Thank you for this kind note and for all of the powerful writing you give to the world.'

b'Companies have a critical role to play in the pursuit of environmental sustainability. By signing onto the #ClimatePledge, @Amazon is aligning their actions with their values and I hope others will do the same. We all need to work to be responsible stewards of the environment. https://t.co/1PDoh2XhGD'

b'On the anniversary of @BillieJeanKing\xe2\x80\x99s victory in the #BattleoftheSexes tennis match, we should all reflect on the strength and determination required to win. Billie Jean teaches us that our identity should never make us feel inadequate to tackle the challenges ahead of us. https://t.co/45xlJuRy4T'

b"I'm honored to join the @smithsoniannpg walls this year with a remarkable group of individuals who have inspired movements and shaped communities. Thank you to the talented Jon R. Friedman for my portrait. See the newest portrait additions in @VanityFair:  https://t.co/8IjZow8JLf https://t.co/L4ZZFUObHU"
b'@NinaEaston @SellersEaston Thank you for leading such a great conversation, @NinaEaston!'

b"It was a privilege to speak with @NinaEaston in the presence of such an impressive sisterhood at @FortuneMPW's International Summit in Toronto. Carving a path for more women at the top of companies is an enormous task, but this group gives me faith that we are more than equipped. https://t.co/OoLDVEJCFK"

b'An excellent piece from Bridgewater Co-CEO Eileen Murray and @YaleSOM on how business leaders must prioritize diversity. The best ideas are ones that challenge us to see from a different perspective and developing leaders who encourage this is essential. https://t.co/ltkzrjI6yI'

b'Reading is a powerful tool to connect to others and challenge your comfort zone. On #InternationalLiteracyDay, I hope you\xe2\x80\x99re inspired to support literacy and access to reading in the world around you. If you could give one book to the community you live in - what would it be? https://t.co/Kvq27WuTQM'

b'Working mothers are no strangers to sacrifice, just take it from the 11 female CEOs interviewed in @FortuneMagazine. These stories hit close to home for me, and they shed light on the strength required to balance the personal and professional spheres: https://t.co/6d3N2lzNev'

b'I loved having the opportunity to attend the #AscendDC2019 Awards Dinner. It was a privilege to speak to and learn from so many motivated professionals across industries. Thank you, @MelissaLeeCNBC, for such a rich discussion! https://t.co/bFOc9BNhJw'

b'As we celebrate #WomensEqualityDay, I\xe2\x80\x99m thinking of Katherine Johnson, the groundbreaking @NASA mathematician whose calculations made the Apollo 11 mission possible. Katherine, who turns 101 years old today, reminds us all that there is never a challenge too big to tackle. https://t.co/8htPzJuzUK'

b'As the tech industry continues developing artificial intelligence for the benefit of society, we must consider AI\xe2\x80\x99s potential to threaten individual privacy. \xe2\x80\x9cThe Big Nine\xe2\x80\x9d by @amywebb is an important exploration of the benefits, risks, and responsibilities that come with AI. https://t.co/EdY5Kwqdbk'

b'On August 18th, we celebrated the 99th anniversary of the 19th Amendment, granting women the right to vote. As we reflect on almost a century of progress, we must build on this legacy to give all voices a pulpit.'

b"What a thoughtful article from @BerlinCameron's @jenbdasilva \xe2\x80\x93 none of us would be where we are today without the guidance and support we\xe2\x80\x99ve received from our female networks. Hearing how women support other women in their careers is incredibly inspiring. https://t.co/eTeyoCT6KN"

b"In a time defined by change, education is the most vital tool we have to keep up. That's why I've always valued reading \xe2\x80\x94 it fuels a desire to see and understand the world through a new lens. This #BookLoversDay, let's pick up a book to ignite this spirit of non-stop education. https://t.co/c6Rrbh6wLM"

b'Reflecting on the 50th anniversary of the #Apollo11 mission, it\xe2\x80\x99s inspiring to hear the stories of women like @poppy_northcutt who broke barriers in science and technology to make this historic event possible. There\xe2\x80\x99s a great deal we can learn from her drive and perseverance. https://t.co/A48hsCg66C'

b'When we empower women to thrive, communities around the world grow stronger as a result. Happy Birthday to @Malala, who is one of our boldest champions. Today and every day we celebrate you. #MalalaDay https://t.co/sChzLcCO76'
b'Congratulations to the @USWNT on your World Cup victory! What an incredible display of strength from a determined group of women.'

b'Growing up, I saw how a sport like cricket can transform a person and a country. It was an honor to be featured in @AbhinayDeo\xe2\x80\x99s movie Doosra, which shows how cricket changed India through the eyes of a young girl. I encourage you to watch the trailer: https://t.co/nwr9qK1CbL'

b'For 15 years, @MLTOrg has been dedicated to developing high-impact diverse leaders. Congratulations to my friend, @MLTJohnRice on this milestone. You are building a better future by empowering our youth and bringing more voices into the workplace.'
